Spokane.Foley Center Library:
The Foley Center Library at Gonzaga University in Spokane, Washington, opened 26 years ago in 1992 and was named for alumnus Ralph E. Foley (1900–1985), a Superior Court judge for 34 years, and his wife, Helen Higgins Foley (1901–1990). They were the parents of Tom Foley (1929–2013), who represented the state's fifth district in Congress for thirty years (1965–1995), the last six as Speaker of the House.
The building is 137,000 square feet (12,700 m2) and is made of 315,000 bricks.
